comment.body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Type assertion masks mismatches; make select props variant-specific.**

`as SelectInputProps<T>` hides that `options`/`onClear` might be undefined at runtime. If `variant="select"` receives no options, `options.filter(...)` will throw.


Consider a discriminated union for `Props<T>`:

- numeric: requires `{ name, register, value }`
- text: requires `{ name, register }`
- select: requires `{ value, options, onClear }` (and optionally `name/register` only if you bind to RHF)

I can push a concrete type-safe refactor if you want it in this PR.

comment.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_

**Ensure cascade chain for deletions (Employee ‚Üí KpiRecord ‚Üí MeritRecord)**

Currently, KpiRecord is deleted on Employee delete (onDelete: Cascade), but MeritRecord references KpiRecord without onDelete, which defaults to RESTRICT. This will block Employee/KpiRecord deletions when a MeritRecord exists.

```diff
-  kpiRecord KpiRecord @relation(fields: [kpiRecordId], references: [id]) 
+  kpiRecord KpiRecord @relation(fields: [kpiRecordId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade) 
```
This maintains a consistent cascade chain and avoids deletion errors.

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
model MeritRecord {
  id String @id @default(uuid())
  kpiRecordId String @unique
  competencyRecordId String @unique
  cultureRecordId String @unique
  year Int
 kpiRecord KpiRecord @relation(fields: [kpiRecordId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  competencyRecord CompetencyRecord @relation(fields: [competencyRecordId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  cultureRecord CultureRecord @relation(fields: [cultureRecordId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  meritEvaluations MeritEvaluation[]
  @@map("meritRecords")
}
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In prisma/schema.prisma around lines 221 to 232, the MeritRecord.kpiRecord
relation lacks an onDelete behavior so it defaults to RESTRICT and will block
deletions; update the kpiRecord relation to include onDelete: Cascade (e.g.,
kpiRecord KpiRecord @relation(fields: [kpiRecordId], references: [id], onDelete:
Cascade)) so that deleting an Employee -> KpiRecord cascades to MeritRecord and
avoids deletion errors.
```

</details>

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.¬†The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues¬†

review.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 3**
üî≠ Outside diff range comments (2)
src/modules/bonus/server/procedure.ts (2)
`40-67`: **Fix race condition when creating kpiRecord (unique constraint window).** Two concurrent requests can both miss the record and then collide on create. Handle P2002 (unique) and re-fetch, or use an upsert with guarded approval check. Apply this diff to make creation resilient while preserving the approval pre-check for the actual-creation path: ```diff let record = await prisma.kpiRecord.findUnique({ where: { employeeId_year: { employeeId, year }, }, }); if (!record) { const approval = await prisma.approval.findFirst({ select: { id: true, }, where: { preparedBy: ctx.user.employee.id, app: "KPI", }, }); if (!approval) { throw new TRPCError({ code: "NOT_FOUND", message: "Not found approval KPI for this employee" }); } - record = await prisma.kpiRecord.create({ - data: { - year, - employeeId: ctx.user.employee.id, - }, - }); + try { + record = await prisma.kpiRecord.create({ + data: { + year, + employeeId: ctx.user.employee.id, + }, + }); + } catch (e: unknown) { + // Handle unique constraint race and re-fetch + if (e instanceof Prisma.PrismaClientKnownRequestError && e.code === "P2002") { + record = await prisma.kpiRecord.findUnique({ + where: { employeeId_year: { employeeId, year } }, + }); + } else { + throw e; + } + } } ``` Add this import at the top of the file: ```ts import { Prisma } from "@prisma/client"; ``` --- `12-18`: **Enforce strict authorization in getByEmployeeId** I located three client callsites for `trpc.kpiBonus.getByEmployeeId`: - **src/modules/bonus/ui/views/bonus-view.tsx:35‚Äì38** Passes a component‚Äêlevel `employeeId` (arbitrary) and `year`. - **src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-form.tsx:73‚Äì76** Uses `session!.user.employeeId` (self) and `year`. - **src/app/(main)/performance/bonus/page.tsx:34‚Äì37** Uses `session.user.employeeId` (self) and `year`. Currently the procedure simply accepts any `employeeId`. You must add server-side checks to prevent unauthorized access: - If users should only access their own bonus, drop the `employeeId` input and use `ctx.user.employee.id` directly. - If managers or HR can view others, verify inside the resolver that ```ts if ( employeeId !== ctx.user.employee.id && !ctx.user.roles.some(r => ['manager','HR'].includes(r)) ) { throw new TRPCError({ code: 'FORBIDDEN' }) } ``` - Otherwise constrain the Zod input to allowed values or add a middleware for role-based guards. Critical fixes are required to avoid leaking one employee‚Äôs data to another.
üßπ Nitpick comments (26)
src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx (1)
`43-46`: **Scrollbar thickness reduced; double-check usability/accessibility** Reducing thickness to 8px (w-2/h-2) can make the thumb harder to grab, especially on touch devices. If this is purely aesthetic, consider verifying that the hit area remains usable in your target environments and OS/browser combinations. Would you like a variant prop (e.g., thickness="sm|md") on ScrollBar to make this configurable per usage?
src/modules/bonus/ui/components/columns.tsx (3)
`6-6`: **Import types as types to avoid runtime import** Use a type-only import for Prisma model/types to keep the runtime bundle leaner. ```diff -import { Kpi, Project, Strategy } from "@/generated/prisma"; +import type { Kpi, Project, Strategy } from "@/generated/prisma"; ``` --- `73-86`: **Use row.original for stronger typing and fewer casts** row.original is typed as Kpi, so you can avoid casts and rely on model typings directly. ```diff - + ``` --- `101-114`: **Same here: prefer row.original over row.getValue** Leverage Kpi typing for better safety and clarity. ```diff - + ```
prisma/schema.prisma (5)
`145-145`: **Redundant @unique on primary key** @id already implies uniqueness; @unique is redundant on id and can be removed. ```diff - id String @id @default(cuid()) @unique + id String @id @default(cuid()) ``` --- `182-193`: **De-duplicate KpiResult by (kpiId, period)** Unless multiple results per period are intended, add a unique constraint to prevent duplicates. ```diff model KpiResult { id String @id @default(uuid()) kpiId String kpi Kpi @relation(fields: [kpiId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade) period Int actual String achievement Int createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt + @@unique([kpiId, period]) @@map("kpiResult") } ``` --- `33-35`: **Make banned non-nullable with default instead of nullable** nullable Boolean with a default is confusing; prefer required Boolean with default(false). ```diff - banned Boolean? @default(false) + banned Boolean @default(false) ``` --- `256-263`: **Add updatedAt to CompetencyRecord** You track creation but not updates here; most other models include updatedAt for audit consistency. ```diff model CompetencyRecord { id String @id @default(uuid()) createdAt DateTime @default(now()) + updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt meritRecord MeritRecord? competencyItem CompetencyItem[] @@map("competencyRecords") } ``` --- `137-142`: **Typo in Strategy enum values (‚ÄúPOEPLE‚Äù)** Enum values are misspelled (POEPLE_*). Fixing later is painful due to data migrations and API coupling. If feasible, correct now or introduce an aliasing plan before public exposure. I can propose a safe migration plan (new enum, mapping in code, data migration, deprecate old values) if you want to address this now or schedule it.
src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-sheet.tsx (3)
`21-24`: **Confirm Sheet onOpenChange handler signature** Passing onClose directly to onOpenChange works if onClose ignores the boolean argument and simply closes. If the intent is to mirror the new state, consider accepting the boolean and delegating accordingly to avoid accidental closures when an "open" event is emitted. Example: ```diff - + { + if (!next) onClose(); + }} + > ``` --- `29-35`: **Icon styling: stroke has no effect on react-icons/bs; add aria-labels for accessibility** The Bs icons are filled SVGs; stroke-[0.25] is likely a no-op. Also, icon-only buttons should have aria-labels. ```diff - ``` --- `37-41`: **Ensure ScrollArea has a reliable height to enable scrolling** Depending on SheetContent‚Äôs layout, the ScrollArea without an explicit height or flex constraint may not scroll as intended. Consider giving it h-full if the parent establishes a height, or a calc-based height aligned to your header spacing. Example: ```diff - + ```
src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-form.tsx (6)
`73-79`: **Guard invalidateQueries against missing session** Non-null assertion on session can throw if the session hasn‚Äôt hydrated yet. Safe-guard the invalidation to avoid runtime errors in edge cases. ```diff - queryClient.invalidateQueries(trpc.kpiBonus.getByEmployeeId.queryOptions({ - employeeId: session!.user.employeeId, - year, - })) + const employeeId = session?.user.employeeId; + if (employeeId) { + queryClient.invalidateQueries( + trpc.kpiBonus.getByEmployeeId.queryOptions({ employeeId, year }) + ); + } ``` --- `80-84`: **Good: user-friendly toast on error** Adding onError with a toast tied to the loading toast id is solid. Consider normalizing server error messages to avoid leaking internals. ```diff - onError: (error) => { - toast.error(error.message, { + onError: (error) => { + const message = error?.message || "Failed to create KPI Bonus. Please try again."; + toast.error(message, { id: loadingToast, }); }, ``` --- `31-31`: **Rename typo: openIndexs ‚Üí openIndices** Minor naming nit for readability and correctness. ```diff - const [openIndexs, setOpenIndexs] = useState(values.map((_, index) => index)); + const [openIndices, setOpenIndices] = useState(values.map((_, index) => index)); ``` And update usages accordingly. --- `56-62`: **Follow-up for rename** Make sure to reflect the rename in toggleIndex and isOpen uses. ```diff - const toggleIndex = (index: number) => { - setOpenIndexs((prev) => + const toggleIndex = (index: number) => { + setOpenIndices((prev) => prev.includes(index) ? prev.filter((i) => i !== index) : [...prev, index] ); } ``` --- `127-134`: **Clearing enum-typed selects with empty strings is fragile** Casting "" as Strategy/Project risks mismatches with your Zod schema/Prisma enums and leaves watch("strategy")/watch("type") as "". Prefer using undefined/null and adjusting the schema to accept optional values, or provide an explicit "None" option. Example change if your schema supports optional values: ```diff - onClear={() => setValue("strategy", "" as Strategy)} + onClear={() => setValue("strategy", undefined as unknown as Strategy, { shouldValidate: true })} ``` And similarly for type. Alternatively, add an explicit None option in options. Also applies to: 149-155 --- `185-190`: **Tighten types for target registration** The casting chain is noisy and easy to break. Use a typed key helper to keep registration strongly typed. ```diff - + ``` If TS complains, define a local type alias: ```ts type TargetKey = keyof KpiBonusSchema["target"]; // "100" | "90" | "80" | "70" const key = String(value) as TargetKey; ... {...register(`target.${key}` as const)} ```
src/components/input-display.tsx (1)
`1-26`: **Harden return type and default case; handle invalid numeric input** Current switch has no default, which can yield undefined if a new variant is introduced later. Also, numeric formatting will render "NaN %" for invalid inputs. pull_request.title: 15: merit models
pull_request.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* New Features
  * Introduced a Merit page with a dedicated view for performance tracking.
  * Added ‚ÄúLink to Strategy‚Äù and ‚ÄúType‚Äù columns to KPI tables for clearer context.
  * Reworked input editor for numeric, text, and select fields with popover editing and selection badges.
  * Bonus creation form is now scrollable; improved error toasts on failure.
  * Updated navigation to direct ‚ÄúCreate KPIs‚Äù to the Merit page.

* Refactor
  * Revamped performance data model to support period-based evaluations, KPI results, and structured merit/competency/culture tracking.

* Style
  * Tweaked scrollbar thickness.
  * Updated KPI Bonus page header copy.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

review.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 3**
üî≠ Outside diff range comments (2)
src/modules/bonus/server/procedure.ts (2)
`40-67`: **Fix race condition when creating kpiRecord (unique constraint window).** Two concurrent requests can both miss the record and then collide on create. Handle P2002 (unique) and re-fetch, or use an upsert with guarded approval check. Apply this diff to make creation resilient while preserving the approval pre-check for the actual-creation path: ```diff let record = await prisma.kpiRecord.findUnique({ where: { employeeId_year: { employeeId, year }, }, }); if (!record) { const approval = await prisma.approval.findFirst({ select: { id: true, }, where: { preparedBy: ctx.user.employee.id, app: "KPI", }, }); if (!approval) { throw new TRPCError({ code: "NOT_FOUND", message: "Not found approval KPI for this employee" }); } - record = await prisma.kpiRecord.create({ - data: { - year, - employeeId: ctx.user.employee.id, - }, - }); + try { + record = await prisma.kpiRecord.create({ + data: { + year, + employeeId: ctx.user.employee.id, + }, + }); + } catch (e: unknown) { + // Handle unique constraint race and re-fetch + if (e instanceof Prisma.PrismaClientKnownRequestError && e.code === "P2002") { + record = await prisma.kpiRecord.findUnique({ + where: { employeeId_year: { employeeId, year } }, + }); + } else { + throw e; + } + } } ``` Add this import at the top of the file: ```ts import { Prisma } from "@prisma/client"; ``` --- `12-18`: **Enforce strict authorization in getByEmployeeId** I located three client callsites for `trpc.kpiBonus.getByEmployeeId`: - **src/modules/bonus/ui/views/bonus-view.tsx:35‚Äì38** Passes a component‚Äêlevel `employeeId` (arbitrary) and `year`. - **src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-form.tsx:73‚Äì76** Uses `session!.user.employeeId` (self) and `year`. - **src/app/(main)/performance/bonus/page.tsx:34‚Äì37** Uses `session.user.employeeId` (self) and `year`. Currently the procedure simply accepts any `employeeId`. You must add server-side checks to prevent unauthorized access: - If users should only access their own bonus, drop the `employeeId` input and use `ctx.user.employee.id` directly. - If managers or HR can view others, verify inside the resolver that ```ts if ( employeeId !== ctx.user.employee.id && !ctx.user.roles.some(r => ['manager','HR'].includes(r)) ) { throw new TRPCError({ code: 'FORBIDDEN' }) } ``` - Otherwise constrain the Zod input to allowed values or add a middleware for role-based guards. Critical fixes are required to avoid leaking one employee‚Äôs data to another.
üßπ Nitpick comments (26)
src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx (1)
`43-46`: **Scrollbar thickness reduced; double-check usability/accessibility** Reducing thickness to 8px (w-2/h-2) can make the thumb harder to grab, especially on touch devices. If this is purely aesthetic, consider verifying that the hit area remains usable in your target environments and OS/browser combinations. Would you like a variant prop (e.g., thickness="sm|md") on ScrollBar to make this configurable per usage?
src/modules/bonus/ui/components/columns.tsx (3)
`6-6`: **Import types as types to avoid runtime import** Use a type-only import for Prisma model/types to keep the runtime bundle leaner. ```diff -import { Kpi, Project, Strategy } from "@/generated/prisma"; +import type { Kpi, Project, Strategy } from "@/generated/prisma"; ``` --- `73-86`: **Use row.original for stronger typing and fewer casts** row.original is typed as Kpi, so you can avoid casts and rely on model typings directly. ```diff - + ``` --- `101-114`: **Same here: prefer row.original over row.getValue** Leverage Kpi typing for better safety and clarity. ```diff - + ```
prisma/schema.prisma (5)
`145-145`: **Redundant @unique on primary key** @id already implies uniqueness; @unique is redundant on id and can be removed. ```diff - id String @id @default(cuid()) @unique + id String @id @default(cuid()) ``` --- `182-193`: **De-duplicate KpiResult by (kpiId, period)** Unless multiple results per period are intended, add a unique constraint to prevent duplicates. ```diff model KpiResult { id String @id @default(uuid()) kpiId String kpi Kpi @relation(fields: [kpiId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade) period Int actual String achievement Int createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt + @@unique([kpiId, period]) @@map("kpiResult") } ``` --- `33-35`: **Make banned non-nullable with default instead of nullable** nullable Boolean with a default is confusing; prefer required Boolean with default(false). ```diff - banned Boolean? @default(false) + banned Boolean @default(false) ``` --- `256-263`: **Add updatedAt to CompetencyRecord** You track creation but not updates here; most other models include updatedAt for audit consistency. ```diff model CompetencyRecord { id String @id @default(uuid()) createdAt DateTime @default(now()) + updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt meritRecord MeritRecord? competencyItem CompetencyItem[] @@map("competencyRecords") } ``` --- `137-142`: **Typo in Strategy enum values (‚ÄúPOEPLE‚Äù)** Enum values are misspelled (POEPLE_*). Fixing later is painful due to data migrations and API coupling. If feasible, correct now or introduce an aliasing plan before public exposure. I can propose a safe migration plan (new enum, mapping in code, data migration, deprecate old values) if you want to address this now or schedule it.
src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-sheet.tsx (3)
`21-24`: **Confirm Sheet onOpenChange handler signature** Passing onClose directly to onOpenChange works if onClose ignores the boolean argument and simply closes. If the intent is to mirror the new state, consider accepting the boolean and delegating accordingly to avoid accidental closures when an "open" event is emitted. Example: ```diff - + { + if (!next) onClose(); + }} + > ``` --- `29-35`: **Icon styling: stroke has no effect on react-icons/bs; add aria-labels for accessibility** The Bs icons are filled SVGs; stroke-[0.25] is likely a no-op. src/modules/bonus/ui/components/bonus-create-form.tsx (6)

Consider normalizing server error messages to avoid leaking internals. ```diff - onError: (error) => { - toast.error(error.message, { + onError: (error) => { + const message = error?.message || "Failed to create KPI Bonus. Please try again."; + toast.error(message, { id: loadingToast, }); }, ``` --- `31-31`: **Rename typo: openIndexs ‚Üí openIndices** Minor naming nit for readability and correctness. ```diff - const [openIndexs, setOpenIndexs] = useState(values.map((_, index) => index)); + const [openIndices, setOpenIndices] = useState(values.map((_, index) => index)); ``` And update usages accordingly. --- `56-62`: **Follow-up for rename** Make sure to reflect the rename in toggleIndex and isOpen uses. ```diff - const toggleIndex = (index: number) => { - setOpenIndexs((prev) => + const toggleIndex = (index: number) => { + setOpenIndices((prev) => prev.includes(index) ? prev.filter((i) => i !== index) : [...prev, index] ); } ``` --- `127-134`: **Clearing enum-typed selects with empty strings is fragile** Casting "" as Strategy/Project risks mismatches with your Zod schema/Prisma enums and leaves watch("strategy")/watch("type") as "". Prefer using undefined/null and adjusting the schema to accept optional values, or provide an explicit "None" option. Example change if your schema supports optional values: ```diff - onClear={() => setValue("strategy", "" as Strategy)} + onClear={() => setValue("strategy", undefined as unknown as Strategy, { shouldValidate: true })} ``` And similarly for type. Alternatively, add an explicit None option in options. Also applies to: 149-155 --- `185-190`: **Tighten types for target registration** The casting chain is noisy and easy to break. Use a typed key helper to keep registration strongly typed. ```diff - + ``` If TS complains, define a local type alias: ```ts type TargetKey = keyof KpiBonusSchema["target"]; // "100" | "90" | "80" | "70" const key = String(value) as TargetKey; ... {...register(`target.${key}` as const)} ```

This asymmetry can lead to `undefined` being passed. Either make it required at the top for `variant="select"`, or handle undefined here. Minimal change: make `onClear` optional here and guard the usage: ```diff -}: { +}: { name: Path; value: string; options: { key: string; label: string; onSelect: (value: string) => void; }[]; - onClear: () => void; + onClear?: () => void; }) { ``` And update: ```diff - + ``` (SelectionBadge already tolerates undefined onClick via data-click.) --- `135-137`: **Selection state should key off the option key, not the label.** `aria-selected={value === label}` assumes `value` is the label. If your state tracks keys (recommended), compare keys. - Track `selectedKey` and compare `selectedKey === key` for `aria-selected`. - Render the badge using the label derived from the key. If you want, I can wire a `selectedKey` prop and adjust `InputDisplay` accordingly. --- `33-40`: **Popover content sizing: consider making width/offset configurable.** Hard-coding `"w-[248px]"` and `sideOffset={-32}` makes reuse harder and can misalign in responsive contexts. Expose `contentClassName` and/or `sideOffset` as optional props to `FieldInput` with sensible defaults.

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* New Features
  * Introduced a Merit page with a dedicated view for performance tracking.
  * Added ‚ÄúLink to Strategy‚Äù and ‚ÄúType‚Äù columns to KPI tables for clearer context.

* Refactor
  * Revamped performance data model to support period-based evaluations, KPI results, and structured merit/competency/culture tracking.

* Style
  * Tweaked scrollbar thickness.
  * Updated KPI Bonus page header copy.

repo.name: J-GenHel
repo.description: Complex helicopter model based on the General Helicopter (GenHel) flight dynamics simulation model. This model is representative of a utility helicopter similar to a UH-60. The model contains a 6-DoF rigid-body dynamic model of the fuselage, nonlinear aerodynamic lookup tables for the fuselage, rotor blades, and empennage, rigid flap and lead-lag rotor blade dynamics, a three-state Pitt-Peters inflow model, and a one-state tail rotor inflow model.

release.name: QZ nightly build 20250817
release.body:
This is a nightly build of QZ.

You can use this if you want to try new features without waiting for releases.
From time to time, in development builds, old difficult-to-reproduce bugs are
fixed, but it is also true that in the development process with the introduction
of new complex code, the stability of the program may suffer compared to
official releases, so **use it with caution**!

## Windows Builds:
- **windows-msvc2019**: Recommended for Windows 10
- **windows-msvc2022**: Recommended for Windows 11 (experimental, QT6)
- **windows**: MinGW build (alternative version)

## Other Platforms:
- **fdroid-android-trial**: Android build
- **nordictrack-android-trial**: Nordictrack build for iFIT2 Tablets
- **raspberry-pi-binary**: Raspberry Pi build

__Please help us improve QZ by reporting any issues you encounter!__ :wink:

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=frappe/hrms&utm_content=3476):

- Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:
  - `I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>, please review it.`
  - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.`
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query.
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`

### Support

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR/Issue comments)

Type `@coderabbitai help` to get the list of available commands.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### CodeRabbit Configuration File (`.coderabbit.yaml`)

- You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a `.coderabbit.yaml` file to the root of your repository.
- Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information.
- If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json`

### Status, Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Status Page](https://status.coderabbit.ai) to check the current availability of CodeRabbit.
- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.¬†The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues¬†

pull_request.title: Feat/support
pull_request.body:
# Pull Request

## Description  
This PR enhances the Help ‚Üí FAQ page UI/UX and updates i18n resources for both English (en) and Korean (ko).

### What‚Äôs changed
 - Accordion UX polish
  - Fully hides collapsed content (no peek-through): conditional py-0, opacity-0, pointer-events-none, aria-hidden
  - Smooth transition of max-height, padding, and opacity
  - Accessible toggles via aria-expanded/aria-controls
- Category tabs + Search workflow
  - Tabs: booking, payment, account, policy, technical
  - Stabilized search: split input into input (typing state) and searchTerm (confirmed via Enter or Search button) to avoid list ‚Äújumping‚Äù
  - Cross-category search when a query is confirmed: matches question/answer text and category title (e.g., searching ‚Äúrefund‚Äù surfaces items in the Payment group even if Booking tab is selected)
  - Clear button resets search and re-enables tabs
  - Results show grouped by category in search mode; in non-search mode, only active tab items are shown
  - Result count indicator
- CTA & contact link
  - ‚ÄúStill need help?‚Äù section with button linking to /${locale}/help/contact
- Accessibility
  - Labels for inputs, aria-disabled for tabs during search, keyboard handling (Enter to search)
- i18n updates (en/ko)
  - Added common keys: common.search, common.clear
  - Added helper strings: faq.searchingAll, improved faq.resultsCount, faq.empty, faq.subtitle, faq.cta.*, faq.feedback.*
  - Ensured FAQ data loaded via returnObjects: true is handled safely
- Locale-aware routing
  - Link to contact page uses /${locale}/help/contact to avoid duplicate prefixes or missing locale
- Refactor / safety
  - Guarded i18n array access with getQnaArray
  - useMemo used for derived lists to avoid unnecessary recalculations
- (SEO optional)
  - Removed dynamic JSON-LD that changed on each keystroke; can re-introduce a stable, limited FAQPage schema in a follow-up if desired

## Why  
- Prevents the content area from ‚Äúpeeking‚Äù when collapsed
- Avoids motion sickness from list re-rendering on every keystroke
- Lets users find items via category keywords (e.g., ‚ÄúÌôòÎ∂à / refund‚Äù) even if they‚Äôre on a different tab
- Improves accessibility and clarity
- Keeps translations consistent and ready for future growth of FAQ content

## Testing  
Local steps
1. Navigate to /{locale}/help (e.g., /ko/help, /en/help).
2. Accordion
  - Click a question ‚Üí content expands smoothly.
  - Click again ‚Üí content fully hides (no residual spacing or opacity).
3. Tabs
  - Click different category tabs and confirm only that category‚Äôs items render.
4. Search (confirmed mode)
  - Type a keyword (e.g., ‚Äúrefund‚Äù / ‚ÄúÌôòÎ∂à‚Äù) but do not press Enter ‚Üí list should not change.
  - Press Enter or click Search ‚Üí search mode activates; results grouped by category appear; tabs dim/disable.
  - Click Clear ‚Üí search mode ends; tabs reactive; original tab list returns.
5. Category keyword search
  - From any tab, search a category term (e.g., typing ‚Äúpayment‚Äù or ‚ÄúÍ≤∞Ï†ú‚Äù) and confirm results from that category appear.
6. Contact link
  - Click ‚ÄúContact Support‚Äù ‚Üí navigates to /${locale}/help/contact.
7. i18n
  - Switch between en and ko locales; verify all labels/buttons/text render correctly.

## Linked Issues  
None

## Checklist  
<!-- 
Mark completed items with an [x]  
-->
- [x] Code builds and runs locally  
- [ ] Component or util func created  
- [ ] Page layout added  
- [x] Tests (if any) pass  
- [ ] I have reviewed my code for clarity and best practices
